content.text: Python - List Comprehension
List Comprehension
List comprehension offers a shorter syntax when you want to create a new list based on the values of an existing list.
content.html: List comprehension offers a shorter syntax when you want to create a new list based on the values of an existing list.

content.text: Example:
Based on a list of fruits, you want a new list, containing only the fruits with the letter "a" in the name.
content.html: Based on a list of fruits, you want a new list, containing only the fruits with the letter "a" in the name.

content.text: Without list comprehension you will have to write a for statement with a conditional test inside:
content.html: Without list comprehension you will have to write a for statement with a conditional test inside:

content.code_html:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry", "kiwi", "mango"]
newlist = []

for x in fruits:
  if "a" in x:
    newlist.append(x)

print(newlist)

content.text: With list comprehension you can do all that with only one line of code:
content.html: With list comprehension you can do all that with only one line of code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry", "kiwi", "mango"]newlist = [x 
  for x in fruits if "a" in x]print(newlist)

content.code:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry", "kiwi", "mango"]newlist = [x
for x in fruits if "a" in x]print(newlist)

syntax_highlighting.text:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry", "kiwi", "mango"]newlist = [x 
 for x in fruits if "a" in x]print(newlist)

content.code_html:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry", "kiwi", "mango"]

newlist = [x for x in fruits if "a" in x]

print(newlist)

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry", "kiwi", "mango"]newlist = [x 
  for x in fruits if "a" in x]print(newlist)

content.text: The Syntax

syntaxHighlighting.text: newlist = [expression for item in iterable if condition == True]

content.code: newlist = [expression for item in iterable if condition == True]

syntax_highlighting.text: newlist = [expression for item in iterable if condition == True]

content.code_html: newlist = [expression for item in iterable if condition == True]

syntax_highlighting_data.text: newlist = [expression for item in iterable if condition == True]

content.text: The return value is a new list, leaving the old list unchanged.
content.html: The return value is a new list, leaving the old list unchanged.

content.text: Condition
The condition is like a filter that only accepts the items that evaluate to True .
content.html: The condition is like a filter that only accepts the items that evaluate to True.

syntaxHighlighting.text: newlist = [x for x in fruits if x != "apple"]

content.code: newlist = [x for x in fruits if x != "apple"]

syntax_highlighting.text: newlist = [x for x in fruits if x != "apple"]

content.code_html: newlist = [x for x in fruits if x != "apple"]

syntax_highlighting_data.text: newlist = [x for x in fruits if x != "apple"]

content.text: The condition if x != "apple" will return True for all elements other than "apple", making the new list contain all fruits except "apple".
content.html: The condition if x != "apple"  will return True for all elements other than "apple", making the new list contain all fruits except "apple".

content.text: The condition is optional and can be omitted:
content.html: The condition is optional and can be omitted:

content.code_html: newlist = [x for x in fruits]

content.text: Iterable
The iterable can be any iterable object, like a list, tuple, set etc.
content.html: The iterable can be any iterable object, like a list, tuple, set etc.

content.code_html: newlist = [x for x in range(10)]

content.text: Same example, but with a condition:

syntaxHighlighting.text: newlist = [x for x in range(10) if x < 5]

content.code: newlist = [x for x in range(10) if x < 5]

syntax_highlighting.text: newlist = [x for x in range(10) if x < 5]

content.code_html: newlist = [x for x in range(10) if x < 5]

syntax_highlighting_data.text: newlist = [x for x in range(10) if x < 5]

content.text: Expression
The expression is the current item in the iteration, but it is also the outcome, which you can manipulate before it ends up like a list item in the new list:
content.html: The expression is the current item in the iteration, but it is also the outcome, which you can manipulate before it ends up like a list item in the new list:

content.code_html: newlist = [x.upper() for x in fruits]

content.text: You can set the outcome to whatever you like:
content.html: You can set the outcome to whatever you like:

content.code_html: newlist = ['hello' for x in fruits]

content.text: The expression can also contain conditions, not like a filter, but as a way to manipulate the outcome:
content.html: The expression can also contain conditions, not like a filter, but as a way to manipulate the outcome:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
newlist = [x if x != "banana" else "orange" 
  for x in fruits]

content.code:
newlist = [x if x != "banana" else "orange"
for x in fruits]

syntax_highlighting.text:
newlist = [x if x != "banana" else "orange" 
 for x in fruits]

content.code_html: newlist = [x if x != "banana" else "orange" for x in fruits]

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
newlist = [x if x != "banana" else "orange" 
  for x in fruits]

content.text: The expression in the example above says:
"Return the item if it is not banana, if it is banana return orange".
content.html: "Return the item if it is not banana, if it is banana return orange".

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Consider the following code: fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry'] newlist = [x for x in fruits if x == 'banana'] What will be the value of newlist ?
content.html:
Consider the following code:
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']
newlist = [x for x in fruits if x == 'banana']
What will be the value of newlist?

metadata.question: Consider the following code:fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']newlist = [x for x in fruits if x == 'banana']What will be the value of newlist?

content.question: Consider the following code:fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']newlist = [x for x in fruits if x == 'banana']What will be the value of newlist?
